title: Tukaram
summary: Sant Tukaram Maharaj (Marathi pronunciation: [t̪ukaːɾam]) was a 17th-century Marathi poet and Hindu sant (saint), popularly known as Tuka, Tukobaraya, Tukoba in Maharashtra.[4] He was a Sant of Varkari sampradaya in Maharashtra, India.[2][3] He was part of the egalitarian, personalized Varkari devotionalism tradition.[5] Sant Tukaram Maharaj is best known for his devotional poetry called Abhanga and community-oriented worship with spiritual songs known as kirtans.[5] His poetry is devoted to the god Vithoba.
